ers was clear, I expanded the idea

stitute.org/AbstractVsConcreteParameters.html. In

esolve the apparent contradiction between

 > I have read your paper and I have some comments. First of all lets

onsider concrete parameters case.
> > If you have to write unit test to the=
 legacy code you are in trouble.

> Have you read Michael Feathers' book =
[1]? In my experience, a lot of
> people aren't test-infected and there is =
a lot of legacy code in the
> world, so a lot of people are in exactly that=
 trouble. I find putting
> tests around such code to be the safest way to e=
nsure that I don't
> break anything in unexpected ways when I need to chang=
e (someone
> else's, obviously! ;-) ) legacy code.
> 
> Cheers,
>
